message: Does anyone watch this? It is the best-written, best-acted show on TV.
I've watched it, agree it's good
Watching the scenes between Kalinda and Blake is like watching a fight with razor blades.
I'm more interested now that you both say it's good
I'll definitely check it out!
Characters will make more sense if you start from the beginning, but I think the drama & complexity will stand on its own even if you jump in.
@Anneflo I can start at the beginning ... I've already started downloading the pilot :)
Wow, you like it that much @Anneflo?  I like it, but I think the strong monster-of-the-week aspect of it takes away from the longer (more interesting) story arcs.
Oh man, I am jealous. To have the experience of watching it all unfold for the first time...enjoy.
thanks @Anneflo!

I think that is why the writing of the show is so elegant - the way they weave the weekly drama into the longer story arcs. They change the focus between them, so it never gets boring. Yes, sometimes it leans more towards the weekly court drama, but always deepens the characters so that the episodes that focus on the longer character story arcs are really powerful. Kind of the way House is constructed, but much much better in my opinion.
well I'm a big House fan, so I'm sold
We're just working our way through the first season. <3 courtroom dramas.
I just watched the first episode - very good
now going to watch the second!
I'll be very curious what you think as you get into it.
I've seen 4 episodes now and I really like it! I'm going to keep watching.
Yay! IMO it just keeps getting better. Let me know when you get to an episode that you particularly like.
Such an erotic love/hate scene between them, like I have never seen on TV. I rewound and watched again, to make sure I caught all the moving parts.
"Moving parts" as in, complicated nuances and references to different things; not, ahem, moving parts...
PLEASE tell me someone saw this weeks episode. It was un-fucking-believably good. WTF happened between Kalinda and Blake?
One of the best shows on TV.  Bar none!
Thank you! Thank you for speaking up. Is this show overlooked, or what?
One word: Kalinda! Sexy, Sexy, Sexy!
I love the addition of Ferrera - and with Alan Cumming? Holy smokes, they were terrific. I think that Diane Lockhart is my hero, too :) Can't wait to see the boardroom showdown next week.
Oooooh the intrigue! Really had me going! Excellent episode.
The Good Wife is the best drama on t.v. right now, bar none.

I also love how they have episodes that are about current afairs.
For example, the episode a few weeks about that was about a billionaire software entrepreneur that has a movie made about him that is wildly innacurate. In other words, an analogy to "The Social Network" and Zuckerberg
Agree totally! I also find the writing on this show is terrific. I think of it as being as sharp as West Wing was; not as fast-paced, but equally smart.
I just know that Alicia is going to find out. How she reacts will be interesting. And I love having Cary in the DA's office - makes it so much more interesting than if he were at Lockhart Gardner.
My heart was pounding during this week's episode! Each story line had such suspense and drama. The writing is so awesome on this show.
And that murderer was SO CREEPY. Will he come back in future episodes with his fixation for Alicia?
I tried not to be too specific, so I hope I wasn't TOO much of a spoiler :) Sometimes after the show, though, I just feel like I've got to say something to somebody about how terrific it is!
Don't spoil this weeks episode for me.  I have not watched it yet!....:) Just kidding.  Best show on TV! (since Damages is no longer on network TV....)
Hmm, I may just have to check this out.
Like a fugue with all the moving parts tonight!
